abstract: The house designer Ricardo Tisci delivered a look that is all tough and refined and, literally, ready to wear now and for seasons to come.
lead_paragraph: "This prefall collection is all about the best of Givenchy," the house designer Ricardo Tisci said at yesterday's presentation. Inserting a mix of what Tisci named "American 1950s housewife" and "French '70s style" into "the best of our men's, women's and couture," he delivered a look that is all tough and refined and, literally, ready to wear now and for seasons to come. Hits include pieces featuring a subtle paillette print, a herringbone and cashmere suit, wool jackets stiffened with men's fabrications, then wrapped in places with the softest organza, and this expertly tailored croc-trimmed tuxedo. Worth noting also are the collection's elongating boots, furry baseball caps and sharp talon ear studs (see: editors swooning).
